commit_message:
FT of scale/modify v2 APIs

This patch add scale/modify functional tests of v2 APIs to the
following test cases:
* Test basic lcms for v2 api Max pattern.
* Test basic lcms for v2 api Min pattern.
* Test rollback update VNF for v2 api.
* Test update and scale out's before/after for v2 api.

Implements: blueprint support-nfv-solv3-scale-vnf
Implements: blueprint support-nfv-solv3-modify-vnf
Closes-bug: #1962564
Change-Id: I0826f1c580a56cec860d59ae0eeb197e8d30f344

messages: [{'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2022-03-09 20:22:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2022-03-09 20:23:04.000000000', 'content': 'Topic ci-ironic-when-neutron-stable/xena removed'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2022-03-09 20:23:09.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to ironic-ci'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2022-03-09 20:25:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2022-03-10 08:01:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2022-03-10 08:16:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:\n\n(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2022-03-10 09:21:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-03-09 20:22:59.000000000', 'message': '[CI] Use Tenks in Ironic job

Installs Tenks [1] and uses it to create virtual machines to pose
as bare metal compute nodes.
The nodes are registered in Ironic, and used to provision
instances.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/tenks/latest/

This backport contains change I552417b9da03b8dfc9406e0ff644092579bc7122

[CI] Ironic: use ipmitool retries

In Ironic jobs with Tenks, we saw issues with IPMI commands
failing, resuling in job failures:

  Error setting Chassis Boot Parameter 5

A metal3.io commit [2] was found that fixes the issue by moving IPMI
retries from ironic to ipmitool, which has a side-effect of increasing
the timeout. This change applies the same configuration.

This change has been adapted from an analogous change in
kayobe-config-dev. [3]

[2] https://github.com/metal3-io/ironic-image/commit/6bc1499d8bb04c2c859b970b3739c3a8ed66ae2a
[3] Ib4fce74cebebe85c31049eafe2eeb6b28dfab041

Change-Id: Idfb8fbb50dc7442225967b2a2ec38ae7114f3c11
Co-Authored-By: Mark Goddard <mark@stackhpc.com>
(cherry picked from commit 91778aca76cc5df534de0a95d84363c834c2657a)
(cherry picked from commit a6145d678d32a456ec7dd9182a36a1628ff21b9a)
'}, {'created': '2022-03-09 20:25:37.000000000', 'message': '[CI] Use Tenks in Ironic job

This change has been adapted from an analogous change in

[2] https://github.com/metal3-io/ironic-image/commit/6bc1499d8bb04c2c859b970b3739c3a8ed66ae2a

commit_message:
[CI] Use Tenks in Ironic job

Installs Tenks [1] and uses it to create virtual machines to pose
as bare metal compute nodes.
The nodes are registered in Ironic, and used to provision
instances.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/tenks/latest/

This backport contains change I552417b9da03b8dfc9406e0ff644092579bc7122

[CI] Ironic: use ipmitool retries

In Ironic jobs with Tenks, we saw issues with IPMI commands
failing, resuling in job failures:

  Error setting Chassis Boot Parameter 5

A metal3.io commit [2] was found that fixes the issue by moving IPMI
retries from ironic to ipmitool, which has a side-effect of increasing
the timeout. This change applies the same configuration.

This change has been adapted from an analogous change in
kayobe-config-dev. [3]

[2] https://github.com/metal3-io/ironic-image/commit/6bc1499d8bb04c2c859b970b3739c3a8ed66ae2a
[3] Ib4fce74cebebe85c31049eafe2eeb6b28dfab041

Change-Id: Idfb8fbb50dc7442225967b2a2ec38ae7114f3c11
Co-Authored-By: Mark Goddard <mark@stackhpc.com>
(cherry picked from commit 91778aca76cc5df534de0a95d84363c834c2657a)
(cherry picked from commit a6145d678d32a456ec7dd9182a36a1628ff21b9a)

Bumping the role to v1.13.1 here: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kayobe/+/833007'}, {'account_id': 14200, 'date': '2022-03-10 10:24:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-03-09 14:35:19.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Add the bonding 802.3ad aggregation selection option"

This reverts commit 8e36626e3ed41793c79d95951be6000d9b1e480e.

Reason for revert: The update of MichaelRigart.interfaces to v1.13.0
introduced a regression due to
https://github.com/michaelrigart/ansible-role-interfaces/pull/118.
Configuration for active interfaces could be removed and not recreated,
if not present in the kayobe network interface configuration. This
affects the Kayobe development environment, in which the configuration does not touch the host's real network interfaces. That 
would lead to DHCP leases not being renewed, and consequent loss of
access to the host.

Change-Id: I78e63704cbdb3f63f042a755d369875bca722c3d
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Add the bonding 802.3ad aggregation selection option"

This reverts commit 8e36626e3ed41793c79d95951be6000d9b1e480e.

Reason for revert: The update of MichaelRigart.interfaces to v1.13.0
introduced a regression due to
https://github.com/michaelrigart/ansible-role-interfaces/pull/118.
Configuration for active interfaces could be removed and not recreated,
if not present in the kayobe network interface configuration. This
affects the Kayobe development environment, in which the configuration does not touch the host's real network interfaces. That 
would lead to DHCP leases not being renewed, and consequent loss of
access to the host.

Change-Id: I78e63704cbdb3f63f042a755d369875bca722c3d

subject: CI: Drop swiftclient-swift-functional-py2 job
messages: [{'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2022-03-10 00:53:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2022-03-10 05:50:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-03-10 00:53:35.000000000', 'message': 'CI: Drop swiftclient-swift-functional-py2 job

It got busted somewhere between 2022-01-15 and 2022-02-11; looks like
needing to override devstack to install on bionic finally caught up with
us. ;-)

FWIW, it fails down in stack.sh while trying to pip install grpcio:

   commands.CommandError: We expect a missing `_needs_stub` attribute
   from older versions of setuptools. Consider upgrading setuptools.

Change-Id: Iff9094e9dd7a3d0bcdb0dee3b08fa5b61c9186d0
'}]
commit_message:
CI: Drop swiftclient-swift-functional-py2 job

It got busted somewhere between 2022-01-15 and 2022-02-11; looks like
needing to override devstack to install on bionic finally caught up with
us. ;-)

FWIW, it fails down in stack.sh while trying to pip install grpcio:

   commands.CommandError: We expect a missing `_needs_stub` attribute
   from older versions of setuptools. Consider upgrading setuptools.

Change-Id: Iff9094e9dd7a3d0bcdb0dee3b08fa5b61c9186d0

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2022-03-07 15:49:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Roughly speaking, you propose a change which updates occurrences of x/sushy-oem-idrac to openstack/sushy-oem-idrac in the openstack/project-config Git repository, and add it to the list of requested renames at https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Meetings/InfraTeamMeeting#Upcoming_Project_Renames so the OpenDev sysadmins can schedule it into a maintenance window.

When moving the gerrit/acls/x/sushy-oem-idrac.config file into the openstack directory, you'll also want to add an [access] section with "inheritFrom = openstack/meta-config" similar to other openstack ACLs.

Note that renaming the entry in the zuul/main.yaml file will cause the change to fail with a configuration error because Zuul can't find the new project in Gerrit. This can be solved by making that edit in a second change (which will still fail) with the other modifications in its Git parent (which can be linted successfully that way).'}, {'account_id': 27909, 'date': '2022-03-08 11:06:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2022-03-08 12:11:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

If you're concerned this change isn't going to be approved by the TC then I'd suggest you wait. If its approval is a foregone conclusion, on the other hand, you may as well get started; but you should probably set this as a depends-on for the first project/config change if you do, so reviewers will be aware of its progress and don't have to ask."}, {'account_id': 16708, 'date': '2022-03-08 19:28:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2022-03-08 22:25:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1 Workflow+1

commit_message:
Add sushy-oem-idrac as Hardware Vendor SIG owned

sushy-oem-idrac is iDRAC specific OEM extension of vendor-independent
sushy library and both use Redfish to communicate with BMCs in Ironic.

It has been proposed to be owned by Hardware SIG at openstack-discuss
mailing list [1].

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2022-February/027418.html

Change-Id: I0f011af28c8aee9a14d666ff7fc1715d7edd592d

commit_message:
Remove stale interfaces

Since [1] is merged we can use the 'MichaelRigart.interfaces' role to
cleanup stale interfaces via 'interfaces_workaround_centos_remove'
variable on CentOS systems.

Also this change adds the documentation with case when this should be
used, and describes manual workaround for both CentOS and Ubuntu.

1. https://github.com/michaelrigart/ansible-role-interfaces/pull/118

Change-Id: I8af3bd198b06f3fd92d09851c045f018cc7aa70f
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <maksim.malchuk@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Fix links of v2 API resources

This patch fixes URL in _links attribute of v2 API resources
such as VnfInstance. It was '{endpoint}/v2/vnflcm/...' wrongly.
It is '{endpoint}/vnflcm/v2/...' correctly.

Closes-bug: #1963683
Change-Id: I57295d89322b94c00472abc374b8a0aefc14374d

[{'created': '2022-03-07 15:14:41.000000000', 'message': 'Clarify documentation about source override

The current documentation about source override is ambiguous and let
users presume that you should always use "-base" after the project name
you want to override source location.

This assumption is wrong, as kolla look for a section who match exactly
the name of the image. Images who don't have a "-base", like Horizon,
are really hard to override for a user.

I propose to put an example without a "-base" and also add a disclaimer
in the documentation about that.

Change-Id: I308a352975f11c29afb3f2ea1c22212062066b4b
'}, {'created': '2022-03-07 15:43:28.000000000', 'message': 'Clarify documentation about source override

users presume that you should always use "-base" after the project name
you want to override source location.

This assumption is wrong, as kolla look for a section who match exactly
the name of the image. Images who don't have a "-base", like Horizon,
are really hard to override for a user.

I propose to put an example without a "-base" and also add a disclaimer
in the documentation about that.

Change-Id: I308a352975f11c29afb3f2ea1c22212062066b4b
'}]
commit_message:
Clarify documentation about source override

The current documentation about source override is ambiguous and let
users presume that you should always use "-base" after the project name
you want to override source location.

This assumption is wrong, as kolla look for a section who match exactly
the name of the image. Images who don't have a "-base", like Horizon,
are really hard to override for a user.

I propose to put an example without a "-base" and also add a disclaimer
in the documentation about that.

Change-Id: I308a352975f11c29afb3f2ea1c22212062066b4b

Fix dstat options

--top-io-adv and --top-cpu-adv aren't options in c8, so let's make their
usage dynamic

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-03-07 20:08:22.000000000', 'message': 'pin out some package from Debian OpenStack Team repos

Debian OpenStack Team backports many packages to get their stuff done.
Sometimes something goes wrong:

INFO:kolla.common.utils.kolla-toolbox:The following packages have unmet dependencies:
INFO:kolla.common.utils.kolla-toolbox: git : Depends: git-man (< 1:2.30.2-.) but 1:2.34.1-1~bpo11+1 is to be installed
INFO:kolla.common.utils.kolla-toolbox:E: Unable to correct problems, you have held broken packages.

So let pin out problematic packages as we are fine with bullseye version
of git.

Change-Id: I8c740655c7f7803d9ab36dac79d30e35e65dd586
(cherry picked from commit 2553c1845c7c4cf04d720b820e4bb13519eca4c9)
'}]
commit_message:
pin out some package from Debian OpenStack Team repos

Debian OpenStack Team backports many packages to get their stuff done.
Sometimes something goes wrong:

INFO:kolla.common.utils.kolla-toolbox:The following packages have unmet dependencies:
INFO:kolla.common.utils.kolla-toolbox: git : Depends: git-man (< 1:2.30.2-.) but 1:2.34.1-1~bpo11+1 is to be installed
INFO:kolla.common.utils.kolla-toolbox:E: Unable to correct problems, you have held broken packages.

So let pin out problematic packages as we are fine with bullseye version
of git.

Change-Id: I8c740655c7f7803d9ab36dac79d30e35e65dd586
(cherry picked from commit 2553c1845c7c4cf04d720b820e4bb13519eca4c9)

commit_message:
Add tripleo-ci-base-ovb-standard parent

As a part of CentOS zuul job reparenting effort[1]

This patch will add tripleo-ci-base-standalone-standard
job.

This job will get consumed at rdo side in periodic jobs.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:cs-parenting

Signed-off-by: Amol Kahat <amolkahat@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I625e6b4590670535ded7db7dd8412e9d0c0ffba4

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-03-08 12:19:44.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/yoga

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/yoga branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I594d7dbd192d83dae0a1a02372cc15e310fc68b7
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/yoga

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/yoga branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I594d7dbd192d83dae0a1a02372cc15e310fc68b7

Patches with no response will be merged by Thursday, March 10th.

Signed-off-by: Elod Illes <elod.illes@est.tech>
Change-Id: I0e09e2b0bf1a3046365a700d309658fd3fc1a9c4

automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on

commit_message:
FT of instantiate/scale's ErrorHandling

This patch implements functional tests of v2 APIs as follows:
* Test retry/rollback scale out for v2 api.
* Test rollback instantiate for v2 api.
* Test fail instantiate for v2 api.

Implements: blueprint support-nfv-solv3-error-handling
Change-Id: I8b02ed0e74cc9e9d472927662bbaff68a36c75df

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/yoga

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/yoga branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I50acf0805a323b659c40f92f39673fc644c1e854

commit_message:
Set agent_type in tests

Networking-Baremetal is already hard-coding the agent
type. The issue was that tests don't set agent type in
the Fake Port Context.

Also removes an override of force_config_drive to false
which is causing failures in jobs designed around use
of configuration drives.

Change-Id: I171845e556a45746d9435a11390e510c731f6d5c
Story: 2009898
Task: 44696
(cherry picked from commit 3f25f63578344dbba61c572614f9ccdedc12fb6e)

[{'created': '2022-03-07 13:20:15.000000000', 'message': 'Fix the definition of the field of associated_vnfc_cp_id

This patch will fix the difinition of the field of associated_vnfc_cp_id.

In the current implementation, the field of associated_vnfc_cp_id is not allowed to be null.
But according to ETSI GS NFV-SOL 003 V3.6.1, the cardinality of associatedVnfcCpId is difined as "0..1",
which  means the associated_vnfc_cp_id is nullable.
Therefore, this patch will fix it to comply with the standard of ETSI.

Closes-Bug: #1948925
Change-Id: I612835a7f8dd61c034b0f877d3356c901fc6027f

commit_message:
Fix the definition of associated_vnfc_cp_id

This patch will fix the definition of the field of
associated_vnfc_cp_id. In the current implementation,
the field of associated_vnfc_cp_id is not allowed to be null.
But according to ETSI GS NFV-SOL 003 V3.6.1, the cardinality of
associatedVnfcCpId is defined as "0..1",
which means the associated_vnfc_cp_id is nullable.
Therefore, this patch will fix it to comply with the standard of ETSI.

Closes-Bug: #1948925
Change-Id: I612835a7f8dd61c034b0f877d3356c901fc6027f

commit_message:
Add vnflcm v2 APIs

This patch supports CLI of vnflcm v2 APIs which are added in Yoga
release.

They are as follows.
* vnflcm update
* vnflcm scale
* vnflcm heal
* vnflcm change-ext-conn
* vnflcm op fail
* vnflcm op retry
* vnflcm op rollback

They are common with v1 except heal. An optional parameter
'--additional-param-file' is added to heal CLI.

Implements: blueprint support-nfv-solv3-heal-vnf
Implements: blueprint support-nfv-solv3-change-external-connectivity
Implements: blueprint support-nfv-solv3-modify-vnf
Implements: blueprint support-nfv-solv3-scale-vnf
Implements: blueprint support-nfv-solv3-error-handling
Change-Id: If4acd9c4d35ce7a5bf6c23db1a8238654d536c87

subject: Ensure migrate all the VMs before upgrade the compute

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-03-08 10:14:58.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure migrate all the VMs before upgrade the compute

Currently, there is one case that escape from the nest if/else
statements. When there are instances to migrate and there is no
DO_NO_MIGRATE_IDs, there was returing 0.

This patch fixed that and makes the script return 1, because
there are VMs to migrate.

This patch also removed the second "host_quiesced" called, as
it was previously executed on the while statement.

Co-authored-by: Daniel Mats Niklas Bengtsson <dbengt@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Idfb9899cc9a599bff2e335c74edd7ee4f74e8c06
(cherry picked from commit 305d9fb0d830fdd98b7dc4c4bd92b833ed5916d4)
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure migrate all the VMs before upgrade the compute

Currently, there is one case that escape from the nest if/else
statements. When there are instances to migrate and there is no
DO_NO_MIGRATE_IDs, there was returing 0.

This patch fixed that and makes the script return 1, because
there are VMs to migrate.

This patch also removed the second "host_quiesced" called, as
it was previously executed on the while statement.

Co-authored-by: Daniel Mats Niklas Bengtsson <dbengt@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Idfb9899cc9a599bff2e335c74edd7ee4f74e8c06
(cherry picked from commit 305d9fb0d830fdd98b7dc4c4bd92b833ed5916d4)

subject: Help message of heal cli modified
messages: [{'account_id': 31072, 'date': '2022-03-10 01:58:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 25701, 'date': '2022-03-10 02:44:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 31857, 'date': '2022-03-10 04:46:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-03-10 01:58:35.000000000', 'message': 'Help message of heal cli modified

Usage message of all cli commands of tacker is constructed by
argument parser by default. It includes optional parameter
first and insert mandatory parameter at end.

All cli commands are implemented with this design only
except heal cli.

Heal cli is a special case in which optional parameter is
coming at end and mandatory parameter is coming before optional.
To fix this issue usage parameter of argument parser is set
in heal cli.

Closes-Bug: #1954744

Change-Id: I3b1d04df210ad07d4b9a99f300017d49e2b56f0b
'}]
commit_message:
Help message of heal cli modified

Usage message of all cli commands of tacker is constructed by
argument parser by default. It includes optional parameter
first and insert mandatory parameter at end.

All cli commands are implemented with this design only
except heal cli.

Heal cli is a special case in which optional parameter is
coming at end and mandatory parameter is coming before optional.
To fix this issue usage parameter of argument parser is set
in heal cli.

Closes-Bug: #1954744

Change-Id: I3b1d04df210ad07d4b9a99f300017d49e2b56f0b

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-02-24 03:29:29.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] OAuth2.0 Client Credentials Grant Flow Support

Modify the subscriptions API and the back-end send notifications
processing logic to support a scenario that the notification API
needs OAuth2.0 client credentials authentication. First, the
back-end will get an access token from the notification
authorization server and then access the the notification API
through the access token.

Implements: blueprint oauth2-client-credentials-ext
Change-Id: Ice35bc465b8f7a39baf77fb5e5d8a5307b42baaf
'}, {'created': '2022-02-24 07:32:23.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] OAuth2.0 Client Credentials Grant Flow Support

commit_message:
Fix for subscription with OAuth 2.0 authorization

This patch modifies the back-end send notifications authentication
processing logic and change the property 'subscription_authentication'
to 'authentication'.

Closes-Bug: #1962423
Change-Id: Ice35bc465b8f7a39baf77fb5e5d8a5307b42baaf

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-03-01 18:35:05.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Migrate to privsep

Signed-off-by: Yasufumi Ogawa <yasufum.o@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Id8de4c2bae91718d6ba45ed523edc103f0b21718
'}, {'created': '2022-03-02 14:36:50.000000000', 'message': "Migrate rootwrap to privsep

As a part of the community goal [1], we should replace rootwrap in
favor of privsep.

Although the latest codes don't have a dependency on rootwrap for now,
but it might be happened to introduce a task with root privilege after.
In addition, there are some complex mechanism embeded in Tacker such as
in setuptools or configs under `etc/`. It's hard to drop and restore
them again. So, keep the mechanism active.

In this update, two methods used for tests are implemented in
`tacker/privileged/linux_cmd.py`, but can be used for general purpose.
For the test, it's also including rootwrap for backward compatibility
which will be removed in a future update..

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/migrate-to-privsep.html

Partially-Implements: bp privsep-migration
Signed-off-by: Yasufumi Ogawa <yasufum.o@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Id8de4c2bae91718d6ba45ed523edc103f0b21718
"}, {'created': '2022-03-02 14:40:38.000000000', 'message': "Migrate rootwrap to privsep

in setuptools or configs under `etc/`. It's hard to drop and restore
them again. So, keep the mechanism active.

In this update, two methods used for tests are implemented in
`tacker/privileged/linux_cmd.py`, but can be used for general purpose.
For the test, it's also including rootwrap for backward compatibility
which will be removed in a future update..

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/migrate-to-privsep.html

Partially-Implements: bp privsep-migration
Signed-off-by: Yasufumi Ogawa <yasufum.o@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Id8de4c2bae91718d6ba45ed523edc103f0b21718

commit_message:
Migrate rootwrap to privsep

As a part of the community goal [1], we should replace rootwrap in
favor of privsep.

Although the latest codes don't have a dependency on rootwrap for now,
but it might be happened to introduce a task with root privilege after.
In addition, there are some complex mechanism embeded in Tacker such as
in setuptools or configs under `etc/`. It's hard to drop and restore
them again. So, keep the mechanism active.

In this update, two methods used for tests are implemented in
`tacker/privileged/linux_cmd.py`, but can be used for general purpose.
For the test, it's also including rootwrap for backward compatibility
which will be removed in a future update. It also updates required
libs as bellow for oslo.privsep 2.4.0.
  - eventlet>=0.30.1
  - msgpack>=0.6.0
  - oslo.service>=2.5.0

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/migrate-to-privsep.html

Partially-Implements: bp privsep-migration
Signed-off-by: Yasufumi Ogawa <yasufum.o@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Id8de4c2bae91718d6ba45ed523edc103f0b21718

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-02-28 06:27:29.000000000', 'message': 'Add tripleo-ci-base-multinode-standard parent

As a part of CentOS zuul job reparenting effort [1].
It merges the vars of tripleo-ci-base-multinode,
tripleo-ci-base-multinode-centos-8 into
tripleo-ci-base-multinode-standard.

Then it uses tripleo-ci-base-multinode-standard as a parent
in following child jobs having nodeset:
- tripleo-ci-base-multinode (for c7 jobs)
- tripleo-ci-base-multinode-centos-8
- tripleo-ci-base-multinode-centos-9

Then It will get consumed in the multinode jobs.

[1.] https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:cs-parenting

Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I2f3420d0be112a53c240f9e5539860e5e8673e4b
'}, {'created': '2022-03-02 05:41:53.000000000', 'message': 'Use required-projects-multinode-upstream as parent for multinode jobs

Based on CS job parenting re-structure[1], for multinode jobs,
It follows the following inheritance
tripleo-ci-base-common-required-projects
- tripleo-ci-base
-- tripleo-ci-base-multinode-standard

Change-Id: I3e20f4ceba11f88aafc2800ed5242febf2a1dabb
--- tripleo-ci-base-required-projects-multinode-upstream

For Distro specific
* CentOS 7
tripleo-ci-base-required-projects-multinode-upstream
- tripleo-ci-base-multinode

* CentOS 8
tripleo-ci-base-required-projects-multinode-upstream
- tripleo-ci-base-multinode-centos-8

* CentOS 9
tripleo-ci-base-required-projects-multinode-upstream
- tripleo-ci-base-multinode-centos-9

With the above pattern,

* tripleo-ci-base-multinode-standard will be used as a parent in
  downstream or rdo without much change or override.

* Any Upstream specific multinode var can be placed in the distro
  base job.

[1.] https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:cs-parenting

Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I2f3420d0be112a53c240f9e5539860e5e8673e4b

commit_message:
Use required-projects-multinode-upstream as parent for multinode jobs

Based on CS job parenting re-structure[1], for multinode jobs,
It follows the following inheritance
* tripleo-ci-base-common-required-projects
* tripleo-ci-base
* tripleo-ci-base-multinode-standard
* tripleo-ci-base-required-projects-multinode-upstream

For Distro specific
* CentOS 7
tripleo-ci-base-required-projects-multinode-upstream
- tripleo-ci-base-multinode

* CentOS 8
tripleo-ci-base-required-projects-multinode-upstream
- tripleo-ci-base-multinode-centos-8

* CentOS 9
tripleo-ci-base-required-projects-multinode-upstream
- tripleo-ci-base-multinode-centos-9

With the above pattern,

* tripleo-ci-base-multinode-standard will be used as a parent in
  downstream or rdo.

* Any Upstream specific multinode var can be placed in the distro
  base job.

post-artifact-mult.yml playbook is used in EL8 and EL9 so
it is moved to a new role [2] tripleo-ci-post, to reuse it
at all places.

[1.] https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:cs-parenting
[2]. https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ci/+/832254

Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I2f3420d0be112a53c240f9e5539860e5e8673e4b

It is because the schema validation has mandated it.
Guess what i'm trying to say here is apart from schema validation, there is no check in API[1] SQLAlchemy[2] DB[3] to verify it is a mandatory field but similar holds true for 'provider' which is also a mandatory parameter.

I think the api-ref update looks ok but will leave the review to encryption experts.

commit_message:
[api-ref]control_location should be mandatory

control_location has been required in the
POST /v3/{uid}/types/{tid}/encryption request body since schema
validation was introduced in rocky. Update the api-ref text to be accurate.

https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/block-storage/v3/index.html?expanded=upload-volume-to-image-detail,updates-volume-read-only-access-mode-flag-detail,create-an-encryption-type-detail#create-an-encryption-type

If we don't pass control_location, we will get 400 BadRequest exception,
"Invalid input received: control_location must be defined".

400 POST https://10.43.176.140:8776/v3/2662fad6014f4252b15adb58155335ba/types/c7f79538-9047-400d-b201-b472a04b9669/encryption 0.183s
tempest.lib.common.rest_client: DEBUG:
Request-Head: {}
                  Request-Body: {"encryption": {"provider": "LuksEncryptor"}}
Response-Head: {'status': '400', u'content-length': '100', u'vary': 'OpenStack-API-Version', u'server': 'IAG', u'openstack-api-version': '3.0'}
                  Response-Body: {"badRequest": {"message": "Invalid input received: control_location must be defined", "code": 400}}

Change-Id: I462186878ea8dc856575bca83d25fdcb6e008052

commit_message:
Set agent_type in tests

Networking-Baremetal is already hard-coding the agent
type. The issue was that tests don't set agent type in
the Fake Port Context.

Also removes an override of force_config_drive to false
which is causing failures in jobs designed around use
of configuration drives.

Change-Id: I171845e556a45746d9435a11390e510c731f6d5c
Story: 2009898
Task: 44696

commit_message:
Fix zone update when adding new Bind9 target to pool.

When a new Bind9 is added to the pool, Designate will trigger 'modzone'
rndc command that will fail, unless zone is already present on the backend.

This change will first verify that the zone is present on the backend,
before an update attempt. If zone is not present - zone creation will be
triggered.

Closes-Bug: 1958409

Co-authored-by: Kiran Pawar <kinpaa@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I782bf38a68f24a2e7133ff2afad7c96e2ae6b7f0

[{'created': '2022-02-03 00:59:47.000000000', 'message': "Don't let delete_share to be called if no share was created

When requested, the share API attempts to create a share in the
database. When the DB insert fails, we always assume that the
exception is provenient from quotas and try to delete the share

commit_message:
Don't let delete_share to be called if no share was created

When requested, the share API attempts to create a share in the
database. When the DB insert fails, we always assume that the
exception is provenient from quotas and try to delete the share
and deallocate quotas. This change prevents the call to delete
share to be invoked if a share wasn't created.

Change-Id: I9dce135899e7dcc8be47423593b3fe306af64575

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-02-07 01:58:00.000000000', 'message': 'Hitachi: Add Target Port Assignment for VSP Driver

This patch add target port assignment for the Hitachi VSP Driver.
When setting target port as an extra spec, the defined port is used
for a volume connection.

Implements: bluprint hitachi-vsp-tgt-port-asgn
Change-Id: I2e8d80261fa797c8f3c83c078c29cf1173d46c3c
'}, {'created': '2022-02-10 02:54:08.000000000', 'message': 'Hitachi: Add Target Port Assignment for VSP Driver

This patch add target port assignment for the Hitachi VSP Driver.
When setting target port as an extra spec, the defined port is used
for a volume connection.

Implements: blueprint hitachi-vsp-tgt-port-asgn
Change-Id: I2e8d80261fa797c8f3c83c078c29cf1173d46c3c
'}, {'created': '2022-02-12 03:41:21.000000000', 'message': 'Hitachi: Add Target Port Assignment for VSP Driver

Defining particular ports in extra spec hbsd:target_ports
determines which of the ports specified by the hitachi_target_ports
or the hitachi_compute_target_ports parameters are used to create LUN
paths during volume attach operations for each volume type.

Implements: blueprint hitachi-vsp-tgt-port-asgn
Change-Id: I2e8d80261fa797c8f3c83c078c29cf1173d46c3c
'}, {'created': '2022-02-12 03:44:25.000000000', 'message': 'Hitachi: Add Target Port Assignment for VSP Driver

paths during volume attach operations for each volume type.

commit_message:
Hitachi: Add Target Port Assignment for VSP Driver

Defining particular ports in extra spec "hbsd:target_ports"
determines which of the ports specified by the hitachi_target_ports
or the hitachi_compute_target_ports parameters are used to create LUN
paths during volume attach operations for each volume type.

Implements: blueprint hitachi-vsp-tgt-port-asgn
Change-Id: I2e8d80261fa797c8f3c83c078c29cf1173d46c3c

commit_message:
Bump ansible.netcommon version

Starting from version 2.6.0 ansible.netcommon drops ipaddr filter.

This collection is pulled in as a requirement by openvswitch.

We need to fix version of netcommon to ensure that behaviour stays same.

[1] https://github.com/ansible-collections/ansible.netcommon/commit/db4920ebf6bae6476ff8829e2cf475f19f83a990

Change-Id: Ic110f8cc425482680070d71f8fe3dacfd1f561fd

messages: [{'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2022-03-09 16:14:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2022-03-09 16:14:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2022-03-09 20:30:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2022-03-09 20:31:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-03-09 16:14:46.000000000', 'message': 'Explicitly unset net.ipv4.ip_forward sysctl

While I8bb398e299aa68147004723a18d3a1ec459011e5 stopped setting
the net.ipv4.ip_forward sysctl, this change explicitly removes the
option from the Kolla sysctl config file. In the absence of another
source for this sysctl, it should revert to the default of 0 after the
next reboot.

A deployer looking to more aggressively change the value may set
neutron_l3_agent_host_ipv4_ip_forward to 0. Any deployments still
relying on the previous value may set
neutron_l3_agent_host_ipv4_ip_forward to 1.

Related-Bug: #1945453

Change-Id: I9b39307ad8d6c51e215fe3d3bc56aab998d218ec
(cherry picked from commit caf33be54b3a4c5f2cdd756e122de6aee891154d)

option from the Kolla sysctl config file. In the absence of another

A deployer looking to more aggressively change the value may set
neutron_l3_agent_host_ipv4_ip_forward to 0. Any deployments still

(cherry picked from commit caf33be54b3a4c5f2cdd756e122de6aee891154d)
'}]
commit_message:
Explicitly unset net.ipv4.ip_forward sysctl

While I8bb398e299aa68147004723a18d3a1ec459011e5 stopped setting
the net.ipv4.ip_forward sysctl, this change explicitly removes the
option from the Kolla sysctl config file. In the absence of another
source for this sysctl, it should revert to the default of 0 after the
next reboot.

A deployer looking to more aggressively change the value may set
neutron_l3_agent_host_ipv4_ip_forward to 0. Any deployments still
relying on the previous value may set
neutron_l3_agent_host_ipv4_ip_forward to 1.

Related-Bug: #1945453

Change-Id: I9b39307ad8d6c51e215fe3d3bc56aab998d218ec
(cherry picked from commit caf33be54b3a4c5f2cdd756e122de6aee891154d)

commit_message:
Appoint Martin as Monasca PTL

Martin raised late candidacy for Monasca
Zed cycle PTL

commit_message:
Designate: Ensure pool management by puppet is disabled

The puppet-designate module now supports setting up pools. The feature
is disabled at time of writing but we plan to enable it in an upcoming
release.
Because in TripleO we have separate tasks for pool management, this
ensures the feature is disabled.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/830017
Change-Id: Ie1d6530ec304e89da7a888cbf74511242d3b4717

commit_message:
[stable-only] Fix sphinx doc job

This is a combination of 2 commits to fix gate failure due to recent
failure of build-sphinx-docs-job since python 2 was replaced in it to
python 3.

1. tox: Make everything work with Python 3

Nothing too fancy here except that we've to work around a really ugly
side-effect of blockdiag.

Conflicts:
  tox.ini

Change-Id: Ibd32d30aacae65702d0ccbdb8a02b1667ec4e8ee
(cherry picked from commit b862f6ff35d1611d0d63623a6254fc889012bfb9)

2. Python 3 fix for sphinx doc

In Python 3, dict methods dict.keys() return ‚Äúviews‚Äù instead of lists.
Therefore, the code:

    impls = sorted(matrix.targets.keys())
    impls.sort()

should be replaced by:

    impls = sorted(matrix.targets.keys())

to be Python 3 compatible.

Change-Id: I50477b0ac43adff9e9b0220bd7c48d6ebb6471b3
(cherry picked from commit 8ca01a3abbeb088cab618e856e1d3cddfc5f0d35)

commit_message:
reenable greendns in nova.

Back in the days of centos 6 and python 2.6 eventlet
greendns monkeypatching broke ipv6. As a result nova
has run without greendns monkey patching ever since.
This removes that old workaround allowing modern
eventlet to use greendns for non blocking dns lookups.

Closes-Bug: #1964149
Change-Id: Ia511879d2f5f50a3f63d180258abccf046a7264e

commit_message:
Explicitly unset net.ipv4.ip_forward sysctl

While I8bb398e299aa68147004723a18d3a1ec459011e5 stopped setting
the net.ipv4.ip_forward sysctl, this change explicitly removes the
option from the Kolla sysctl config file. In the absence of another
source for this sysctl, it should revert to the default of 0 after the
next reboot.

A deployer looking to more aggressively change the value may set
neutron_l3_agent_host_ipv4_ip_forward to 0. Any deployments still
relying on the previous value may set
neutron_l3_agent_host_ipv4_ip_forward to 1.

Related-Bug: #1945453

Change-Id: I9b39307ad8d6c51e215fe3d3bc56aab998d218ec
(cherry picked from commit caf33be54b3a4c5f2cdd756e122de6aee891154d)

commit_message:
Explicitly unset net.ipv4.ip_forward sysctl

While I8bb398e299aa68147004723a18d3a1ec459011e5 stopped setting
the net.ipv4.ip_forward sysctl, this change explicitly removes the
option from the Kolla sysctl config file. In the absence of another
source for this sysctl, it should revert to the default of 0 after the
next reboot.

A deployer looking to more aggressively change the value may set
neutron_l3_agent_host_ipv4_ip_forward to 0. Any deployments still
relying on the previous value may set
neutron_l3_agent_host_ipv4_ip_forward to 1.

Related-Bug: #1945453

Change-Id: I9b39307ad8d6c51e215fe3d3bc56aab998d218ec
(cherry picked from commit caf33be54b3a4c5f2cdd756e122de6aee891154d)

commit_message:
Delineate ansible versions across rhel versions

Rhel9 no longer carries a python3-ansible package like in rhel8.
In rhel9, it is called ansible-core.

Change-Id: Id71045062dc986f56b51d70853e1de3608708fe8
Resolves: rhbz#2060886

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-01-31 23:25:21.000000000', 'message': 'Fix waiters to raise on resources going to ERROR

A previous patch[1] updated the wait_for_zone_404 to raise an execption
when the zone goes to ERROR.
This patch updates the rest of the waiters to also abort waiting if the
resource goes into the ERROR status.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/designate-tempest-plugin/+/820075

Change-Id: I5d1e549ccd75fbda518e8851430f58cfa849bd97
'}]
commit_message:
Fix waiters to raise on resources going to ERROR

A previous patch[1] updated the wait_for_zone_404 to raise an execption
when the zone goes to ERROR.
This patch updates the rest of the waiters to also abort waiting if the
resource goes into the ERROR status.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/designate-tempest-plugin/+/820075

Change-Id: I5d1e549ccd75fbda518e8851430f58cfa849bd97

commit_message:
Updates baremetal-full-freeipa playbook to reload NetworkManager

This patch updates the fix to also reload NetworkManager after making
changes to its configuration file. It also adds 'ooo.test' as search
domain since it is hardcoded in deploy_freeipa.sh script.

commit_message:
Comment out train release jobs

The recent addition of the vpn profile seems to break train with
an issue in neutron-vpnaas that tries to find the ussuri release
in train.

Since train is in extendend maintenance anyway and Yoga about to
come out, this change comments out the train jobs to unblock the
gate. Further discussions will happen about potentially dropping
support for Train.

Change-Id: I3242c9244e139fffccde031df1de637e9929e525

commit_message:
compute: Move server migrations commands to their own file

The 'openstackclient.compute.v2.server' module is getting rather large.
The server migration commands don't need to be in there. Move them.

Change-Id: I8b2600cfd9f8e37d3093c52c7222d85e84e7fc89
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Local IP: use LOCAL_IP_TABLE for back flows if no OVS fw

When using static NAT for Local IP translation
ACCEPTED_EGRESS_TRAFFIC_NORMAL_TABLE should be used for back
(learned) flows only in case openvswitch security groups are used.
Otherwise need to use LOCAL_IP_TABLE.

Partial-Bug: #1930200
Change-Id: Ie08a26fab3b23507085e00b02c7e11e037a44f62

commit_message:
compute: Allow retrieval of migration by UUID

The nova API doesn't allow you to retrieve migration records by UUID,
only ID. This is confusing. Work around it by listing records and
filtering this list.

Change-Id: I932c9c70420e85056509513e005bb78168e70611
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
s3api: Properly decode MPU request parameters before using them

Specifically, parameters that may contain non-ASCII characters,
such as the prefix and marker to list current uploads.

Change-Id: Icfae68825f94ddf2412c0274c3d500e265117e8e

'}, {'created': '2022-03-09 00:54:25.000000000', 'message': 'Add README template

Import and convert the charm README template from an
internal document, and improve upon it.

A few significant changes is the removal of a list of
"important/common" configuration options and the removal
of a definitive list of actions:

* options - It is felt that a list is too subjective. It
  is also redundant: the options are also available via
  config.yaml and/or viewed in the Charmhub). We should
  instead put more effort into ensuring the options are
  properly described when developing the charm. As a
  mitigating factor towards a loss of value, many
  "important/common" options will naturally surface in
  the Deployment section. Showcasing the use of various
  options can also be the subject of future tutorials.

* actions - Similar to options, the actions are already
  listed elsewhere (actions.yaml). It is also onerous to
  maintain an up-to-date list from the documentation
  standpoint.

Depends-On: Iae5cdfad42b6775a053a5de8d8e73def318d277d

commit_message:
Add README template

Import and convert the charm README template from an
internal document, and improve upon it.

A few significant changes is the removal of a list of
"important/common" configuration options and the removal
of a definitive list of actions:

* options - It is felt that a list is too subjective. It
  is also redundant: the options are also available via
  config.yaml and/or viewed in the Charmhub. We should
  instead put more effort into ensuring the options are
  properly described when developing the charm. As a
  mitigating factor towards a loss of value, many
  "important/common" options will naturally surface in
  the Deployment section. Showcasing the use of various
  options can also be the subject of future tutorials.

* actions - Similar to options, the actions are already
  listed elsewhere (actions.yaml). It is also onerous to
  maintain an up-to-date list from the documentation
  standpoint.

Depends-On: Iae5cdfad42b6775a053a5de8d8e73def318d277d
Depends-On: Ib3d02d716bdad0bce52ed72b7528ad1ccb301bb3
Depends-On: I433d0b8d7d865c0cbc9647eb30838a6db87ce9c8
Change-Id: Ic8c31d88c5770e306bba2b28d8a88634f852ad8c

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-03-08 23:29:23.000000000', 'message': "DNM: run migration walk tests on arm64

The parent patch increases timouts for some migration tests,
but showed mixed results.  This patch removes everything but the
arm64 template from .zuul.yaml so we can just run those jobs a
few times and see what's up.

Change-Id: If3561ac5add1e677fa0080056ac0abf0616efd1e
"}]
commit_message:
DNM: run migration walk tests on arm64

The parent patch increases timouts for some migration tests,
but showed mixed results.  This patch removes everything but the
arm64 template from .zuul.yaml so we can just run those jobs a
few times and see what's up.

Change-Id: If3561ac5add1e677fa0080056ac0abf0616efd1e

commit_message:
Heal and scale method support of lcm_user_data

Customization of stack parameter during heal and scale through
lcm_user_data.

Implement: blueprint stack-parameter-customization
Change-Id: I393c0fd3ee32ee545ce5adf70b57af97d4177f2c

commit_message:
Correct documentation about Load Balancer API

Many methods claimed to accept a name or ID, while they actually only
accept an ID or a resource object. Updated the documentation
accordingly.

Story: 2009808
Task: 44367
Change-Id: Ida6f9cd3fa1c45394ff8e581a7bd881441d6db69

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-12-30 12:23:48.000000000', 'message': 'Adding new test cases for zone export showfile API

    1) "test_show_exported_zonefile_impersonate_another_project"
       Admin user is able to impersonate another project
       and to "show" created by tenant exports.
       Note: based on: 'x-auth-sudo-project-id' HTTP header.

    2) "test_show_exported_zonefile_all_projects_headers"
       Use admin client to show zone export file of
    \xa0 \xa0all tenants.
       Note: based on: "x-auth-all-projects" HTTP header.

    3) "test_client_accepts_any_MIME_type"
       Validate that 200 OK is received when client
       sends "Accept: */*".

    4) "test_missing_accept_headers"
       Client request is missing Accept header.

    5) "test_show_zonefile_using_not_existing_zone_export_id"
       "404 Not Found" is expected when not existing
       ID is used by client.

    6)"test_show_zonefile_not_supported_accept_value"
      The client try to show file of zone export with

Change-Id: I8aa5dfe12781f21b9f41e0df19afb0e46eab31d8

commit_message:
Adding new test cases for zone export showfile API

    1) "test_show_exported_zonefile_impersonate_another_project"
       Admin user is able to impersonate another project
       and to "show" created by tenant exports.
       Note: based on: 'x-auth-sudo-project-id' HTTP header.

    2) "test_show_exported_zonefile_all_projects"
       Use admin client to show zone export file of
    ¬† ¬†all tenants.
       Note: based on: "x-auth-all-projects" HTTP header.

    3) "test_show_exported_zonefile_any_mime_type"
       Validate that 200 OK and Content-Type: text/dns
       is received when client.
       sends "Accept: */*".

    4) "test_missing_accept_headers"
       Client request is missing Accept header.
       The header will be send with empty dict.
       Expected: {Content-Type: text/dns}

    5) "test_show_zonefile_using_not_existing_zone_export_id"
       "404 Not Found" is expected when not existing
       ID is used by client.

    6)"test_show_zonefile_not_supported_accept_value"
      Client sends 'Accept':'image/jpeg' for ShowZoneFile API.
      Expected: 406 Not Acceptable.

Change-Id: I8aa5dfe12781f21b9f41e0df19afb0e46eab31d8

commit_message:
Add error message when network resources use "set" "unset" command

If you want use the "set" and "unset" command, you must require one
of the optional arguments.
The patch adds an error message when network resources use "set"
and "unset" command without all optional arguments.

Change-Id: I5cc1b65c845faa7b658ca4c3d770aca4090c8736

commit_message:
Remove local openstack.config overrides

We've got a proliferation of different places where we're implementing
overrides on the openstack.config logic. Now that the code in osc-lib
can do all the things we need it to, and openstacksdk is properly doing
the same, we can remove the python-openstackclient versions and collapse
down to only having one place where we override things.

Change-Id: I2d5ff398b593f0524a22b7d8cbf697164e1dd7c4

for non-admins we have no way of checking if the project does exist.

The current situation is therefore somewhat misleading: Admins can
use the project name. If a non-admin uses the project name, it will

commit_message:
Only allow project ID in 'image add project'

Only admin users could use the project name instead of project ID and
for non-admins we have no way of checking if the project does exist.

The current situation is therefore somewhat misleading: Admins can
use the project name. If a non-admin uses the project name, it will
fail, but there is no error nor warning.

This patch unifies the behaviour of image add project by removing the
option to use the project name entirely.

The help message has already been changed accordingly:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/637828/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/638113/

commit_message:
Refactor volume type test for volume service v2

Remove use globals shared by all tests to avoid race conditions.
Each should run independently and allocate it's own resources.

Change-Id: Id2c8c76f863b4d627314a7d50ff4cf22352855f1

commit_message:
Remove insane options from network agent add/remove actions

Currently "network agent add/remove network/router" commands have no
effect except if you use them without the --dhcp/--l3 options!

Such behavior seems incorrect, that's why this change removes these
insane options.

Change-Id: I90010bb231affad28896713a5d6f936902c853d7

[{'created': '2018-03-05 14:42:19.000000000', 'message': "Stop using novaclient for removed actions

novaclient v10 has removed host actions and add/remove floating ip.

The shade layer of the SDK has add/remove floating ip (although this
patch exposes a place where the api is ugly and should be improved)

The os-hosts api doesn't have direct support. We can add resources/proxy
methods to SDK to support it, but for now, just use direct REST calls.

Change-Id: I2da0d74829b0d8af710ac1a1ec9fb07454f469e4
"}]
commit_message:
Stop using novaclient for removed actions

novaclient v10 has removed host actions and add/remove floating ip.

The shade layer of the SDK has add/remove floating ip (although this
patch exposes a place where the api is ugly and should be improved)

The os-hosts api doesn't have direct support. We can add resources/proxy
methods to SDK to support it, but for now, just use direct REST calls.

Change-Id: I2da0d74829b0d8af710ac1a1ec9fb07454f469e4

For example if there will be a version 4, than "version 3 only" means it is only not included in version 4 anymore, while "versionadded:: 3" means it is included in version 3 and any later version.'}, {'account_id': 21514, 'date': '2017-03-24 11:30:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

 > if there will be a version 4, than "version 3 only" means it is
 > only not included in version 4 anymore, while "versionadded:: 3"
 > means it is included in version 3 and any later version.

Good point! But for now they are supposed to mean the same since we have no more newer version, and I think we cannot sure what options will exist in the newer wersion, in my option maybe "version X only" is safer for now since it just descripe the version we can see now (include nothing of the future).'}, {'account_id': 23913, 'date': '2017-03-24 11:35:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> > Are you sure that both are supposed to mean the same? For example

Ok, you are right. But since the standard behaviour is probably that new versions don't delete options but add them, I'd prefer to use only "versionadded:: 3" instead of only using "version 3 only".

commit_message:
Unified the version marks of options in OSC

In OSC, most of one-version-only options were
marked as *XXX version X only*, but some others
markes as ".. versionadded:: X". it may confuse
users, so maybe we can unified the version marks
with the same format.

Change-Id: I6aa76cea5dd45cefba840d7f960289f7f5e49c57

commit_message:
Migrate deprecation tag to a document here

This moves the guidelines of how feature deprecation should be handled
from the definition of assert:follows-standard-deprecation tag to
a document here. It reformats the verbiage therein to describe the
procedures as a guideline instead of adherence to an asserted tag. It
also modifies the procedures to be in line with the newly-adopted
TC resolution to modify the release cadence with tick and tock
designations which impact the timing of deprecations and feature
removals.

Change-Id: I9e6b252e81f893e0007c5b917328b73765d072c7

in "subnet" instead of None. This patch checks not only that "subnet"

Imported from Neutron master:
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/815280

Closes-Bug: #1948466

(manually cherry picked from commit 95c2801da855cada741693b0dc31192e7baa111c)

Change-Id: I63fb7b9bb0bfd8f29b4630482672e7464d5e4d00
'}]
commit_message:
Check subnet in "_remove_subnet_dhcp_options"

Since [1], "get_subnet_dhcp_options" returns always a dictionary
in "subnet" instead of None. This patch checks not only that "subnet"
is None but also the dictionary is not empty.

[1]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/807692

Imported from Neutron master:
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/815280

Closes-Bug: #1948466

Change-Id: Ie93cf3e47e09b3e5051be1ffad512251775b0492
(manually cherry picked from commit 95c2801da855cada741693b0dc31192e7baa111c)

Change-Id: I63fb7b9bb0bfd8f29b4630482672e7464d5e4d00

commit_message:
fix 'huawei dorado v6' FC initiator can be added to host

change the fc initiator filter conditions. we add a config
min_fc_ini_online when the number of online fc initiator
more than the min_fc_ini_online, the online initiator will
added to host

Closes-Bug: #1942218
Change-Id: Idb284e3b5f1b9b427a390f1e105f890ce5d49992

commit_message:
Document new properties used by Ironic

* rootfs_uuid (introduced a while ago) specifies which partition of a
  whole-disk image is a root.
* img_type specifies whether the image is a whole-disk or a partition
  image. Currently Ironic uses kernel_id/ramdisk_id to decide that, but
  this logic only makes sense when booting instances from network.

img_type will be introduced by https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/ironic/+/825305

Change-Id: Idd0d38fc312d08a99b5f5b2072cc991bc4575719

[{'created': '2021-12-09 13:59:13.000000000', 'message': 'Ignore fake nodes in the power sync loop

Fake nodes have power_state None and the power interface returns None as
well. Currently we make an update every loop, even though the values are
the same. This change fixes it.

Change-Id: I5227c058f3f6e1583b54a1cbc7edc6d42e20ae53
'}]
commit_message:
Ignore fake nodes in the power sync loop

Fake nodes have power_state None and the power interface returns None as
well. Currently we make an update every loop, even though the values are
the same. This change fixes it.

Change-Id: I5227c058f3f6e1583b54a1cbc7edc6d42e20ae53

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-03-04 17:19:26.000000000', 'message': 'Explicitly unset net.ipv4.ip_forward sysctl

While I8bb398e299aa68147004723a18d3a1ec459011e5 stopped setting
the net.ipv4.ip_forward sysctl, this change explicitly removes the
option from the Kolla sysctl config file. In the absence of another
source for this sysctl, it should revert to the default of 0 after the
next reboot.

A deployer looking to more aggressively change the value may set
neutron_l3_agent_host_ipv4_ip_forward to 0. Any deployments still
relying on the previous value may set
neutron_l3_agent_host_ipv4_ip_forward to 1.

Related-Bug: #1945453

Change-Id: I9b39307ad8d6c51e215fe3d3bc56aab998d218ec
'}, {'created': '2022-03-07 17:31:46.000000000', 'message': 'Explicitly unset net.ipv4.ip_forward sysctl

While I8bb398e299aa68147004723a18d3a1ec459011e5 stopped setting
the net.ipv4.ip_forward sysctl, this change explicitly removes the
option from the Kolla sysctl config file. In the absence of another
source for this sysctl, it should revert to the default of 0 after the
next reboot.

A deployer looking to more aggressively change the value may set
neutron_l3_agent_host_ipv4_ip_forward to 0. Any deployments still
relying on the previous value may set
neutron_l3_agent_host_ipv4_ip_forward to 1.

Related-Bug: #1945453

Change-Id: I9b39307ad8d6c51e215fe3d3bc56aab998d218ec
'}]
commit_message:
Explicitly unset net.ipv4.ip_forward sysctl

While I8bb398e299aa68147004723a18d3a1ec459011e5 stopped setting
the net.ipv4.ip_forward sysctl, this change explicitly removes the
option from the Kolla sysctl config file. In the absence of another
source for this sysctl, it should revert to the default of 0 after the
next reboot.

A deployer looking to more aggressively change the value may set
neutron_l3_agent_host_ipv4_ip_forward to 0. Any deployments still
relying on the previous value may set
neutron_l3_agent_host_ipv4_ip_forward to 1.

Related-Bug: #1945453

Change-Id: I9b39307ad8d6c51e215fe3d3bc56aab998d218ec

commit_message:
CentOS Stream 8: drop CentOS RabbitMQ 3.8 repo

We need 3.7 in Train in order to handle the transition from CentOS 7 to
8. The RabbitMQ image ends up with 3.7.28, but for certainty, this
change removes the CentOS RabbitMQ 3.8 repository that was added with
the switch to Delorean for CentOS Stream 8.

Change-Id: I120be2b28a7214e6b03976719319e4208d8050ab

commit_message:
Support SB OVSDB connections to non-leader servers

Since SB connections are read-mostly, they should be able to
connect to non-leader clustered ovsdb servers. This will allow
distributing the SB connections for ovn neutron-api and metadta
workers.

Conflict:
    neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/ovsdb/ovsdb_monitor.py

Change-Id: I7442170d015f195a5430e71567fbc7d67b81d385
(cherry picked from commit 10f23398ce43a666c17feeef7c1b516ce3afddff)

[{'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2021-06-01 22:31:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2021-06-02 01:14:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/794048/1/iscsi : SUCCESS in 2h 39m 23s'}, {'account_id': 19234, 'date': '2021-11-04 15:44:46.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to bug/1949808'}, {'account_id': 19234, 'date': '2022-02-23 15:46:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-06-01 22:31:09.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Rollback live migraiton if cancelled while queued

Previously, when we cancelled a queued live migration, we would just
cancel() the future, _do_live_migration() would never run, and we
would leave it at that. While the migration status was correctly
updated to 'cancelled', nothing else was cleaned up, leaving the
instnace in 'MIGRATING', for example.

This patches changes the logic to *only* set the 'cancelled' status in
the live_migration_abort() method. That way, when _do_live_migration()
starts executing, it can notice that the migration has been aborted,
and perform rollback correctly.

Change-Id: I99aa92a6fb50a97a03631c4a60557622f3383807
"}]
commit_message:
WIP: Rollback live migraiton if cancelled while queued

Previously, when we cancelled a queued live migration, we would just
cancel() the future, _do_live_migration() would never run, and we
would leave it at that. While the migration status was correctly
updated to 'cancelled', nothing else was cleaned up, leaving the
instnace in 'MIGRATING', for example.

This patches changes the logic to *only* set the 'cancelled' status in
the live_migration_abort() method. That way, when _do_live_migration()
starts executing, it can notice that the migration has been aborted,
and perform rollback correctly.

Change-Id: I99aa92a6fb50a97a03631c4a60557622f3383807

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-03-09 09:19:52.000000000', 'message': "[devstack] Support config image repository for kubeadm

In some places of which network environment was limited, kubeadm
can't pull images from k8s.gcr.io. This patch add a variable
`KURYR_KUBEADMIN_IMAGE_REPOSITORY` in order to the developer who
located in these places can set the kubeadm to pull container images
from repository that they can access.

Change-Id: Id966747d8c09ea14bb37880f8fb37447591564b5
(cherry picked from commit 8655bb49c80e57be4b773f0a7f8db7c643749b67)
"}]
commit_message:
[devstack] Support config image repository for kubeadm

In some places of which network environment was limited, kubeadm
can't pull images from k8s.gcr.io. This patch add a variable
`KURYR_KUBEADMIN_IMAGE_REPOSITORY` in order to the developer who
located in these places can set the kubeadm to pull container images
from repository that they can access.

Change-Id: Id966747d8c09ea14bb37880f8fb37447591564b5
(cherry picked from commit 8655bb49c80e57be4b773f0a7f8db7c643749b67)

commit_message:
Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is old name and deprecated
This allows to use upper-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

Change-Id: I8d23078566a122cfb5a414546e67d6638782c105

commit_message:
Update release notes of multi tenant policy in LCM

This patch adds a known limitation that non-admin users cannot
instantiate VNFs. Secondly, it should be noted in the feature
description that the current implementation does not fix this issue.

Implement: blueprint multi-tenant-policy
Change-Id: I54570e989a6cf8bb5d19a023b3c50561ed7657db

commit_message:
tests: Centralize configuration of default flavor, image

Different tests were doing this in different ways. Centralize it all in
the base test class for functional tests. For both flavor and image, the
order of precedence is:

- Environment variables
- clouds.yaml configuration
- Guesswork (pick a cirros, Ubuntu or CentOS image for images, or the
  flavor with the lowest RAM for flavors)

Change-Id: I90fda8ef48008c7fa634edc295c0e83e5f29387f
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

subject: Fix 'server event list|show' for deleted servers
messages: [{'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2022-02-09 20:10:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2022-02-09 20:18:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2022-02-09 22:18:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2022-02-09 23:07:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2022-02-09 23:27:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2022-03-09 11:35:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 27900, 'date': '2022-03-09 12:17:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-02-09 20:10:47.000000000', 'message': "Fix 'server event list|show' for deleted servers

As of compute microversion >= 2.21, support for list and show of server
events for deleted servers was added. This however wasn't working using
the openstackclient because the compute GET /servers/{server_id} will
not return a deleted server, so osc_lib.utils.find_resource() fails to
find the server and the command bails early.

This adds a check for a uuid-like <server> arg and uses it directly.

A note is also added to the command help to indicate that list and show
for deleted servers will only work if a server ID is passed (name will
not work).

Story: 2009841
Task: 44443
Change-Id: Icd33b3b9a3a1855d7893dd111bbb2aca059f45fd
"}, {'created': '2022-02-09 20:18:37.000000000', 'message': "Fix 'server event list|show' for deleted servers

"}, {'created': '2022-02-09 23:27:12.000000000', 'message': "Fix 'server event list|show' for deleted servers

As of compute microversion >= 2.21, support for list and show of server
events for deleted servers was added. This however wasn't working using
the openstackclient because the compute GET /servers/{server_id} will
not return a deleted server, so osc_lib.utils.find_resource() fails to
find the server and the command bails early.

This adds a check for a uuid-like <server> arg and uses it directly if
the <server> cannot be found via find_resource().

A note is also added to the command help to indicate that list and show
for deleted servers will only work if a server ID is passed (name will
not work).

Story: 2009841
Task: 44443

Change-Id: Icd33b3b9a3a1855d7893dd111bbb2aca059f45fd
"}]
commit_message:
Fix 'server event list|show' for deleted servers

As of compute microversion >= 2.21, support for list and show of server
events for deleted servers was added. This however wasn't working using
the openstackclient because the compute GET /servers/{server_id} will
not return a deleted server, so osc_lib.utils.find_resource() fails to
find the server and the command bails early.

This adds a check for a uuid-like <server> arg and uses it directly if
the <server> cannot be found via find_resource().

A note is also added to the command help to indicate that list and show
for deleted servers will only work if a server ID is passed (name will
not work).

Story: 2009841
Task: 44443

Change-Id: Icd33b3b9a3a1855d7893dd111bbb2aca059f45fd

commit_message:
Add compute response schema for microversion 2.75

Compute microversion 2.75 made the rebuild and update server
response same as get servers
- https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/reference/api-microversion-history.html#id68

Partially Implements: blueprint fix-microversion-gap

Change-Id: I1728e5de0e815def0fe31c242203bd9f36dc41f4

subject: compute: Use correct command class for 'show migration'
messages:
[{'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-11-03 10:31:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2021-11-04 00:23:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2022-03-09 11:34:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

(1 comment)'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-11-03 10:31:42.000000000', 'message': "compute: Use correct command class for 'show migration'

We should be inheriting from 'ShowOne'. Failure to do so results in a
tuple being dumped to the screen. Not what we intended.

While we're here, we update the docstring of this command to clarify the
command's intent. Nova does not provide an API to retrieve an individual
migration record for a cold migration or completed live migration. As
such, the 'server migration show' command only works for in-progress
live-migrations.

Change-Id: I2e2fe3da7d642b9e8e3d930603dcde178cd68cde
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Story: 2009658
Task: 43837
"}]
commit_message:
compute: Use correct command class for 'show migration'

We should be inheriting from 'ShowOne'. Failure to do so results in a
tuple being dumped to the screen. Not what we intended.

While we're here, we update the docstring of this command to clarify the
command's intent. Nova does not provide an API to retrieve an individual
migration record for a cold migration or completed live migration. As
such, the 'server migration show' command only works for in-progress
live-migrations.

Change-Id: I2e2fe3da7d642b9e8e3d930603dcde178cd68cde
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Story: 2009658
Task: 43837

commit_message:
Remove deprecated timeutils functions

Those functions are deprecated since 2015 and the usage
of the datetime stdlib module should be prefered.

Sem-Ver: api-break
Closes-Bug: #1461251
Closes-Bug: #1715325
Change-Id: If6044e97d82c512b593a45772b8b82c893e8f47c

commit_message:
Improve bump patch readability

Currently we update HEAD date for each SHA, which makes it hard
to track what exactly has been updated.

From now on we will be updating dat only at beginning of the file
which improves review experience and show real changes to SHAs.

Change-Id: I2528d7b624b72674f9dcb953a5b25ec5ca48232a

commit_message:
Add Python3 zed unit tests

This is an automatically generated patch to ensure unit testing
is in place for all the of the tested runtimes for zed.

See also the PTI in governance [1].

[1]: https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html

Change-Id: I928b7ec69a6bc3646c9cbea1ebd861d9dd8b6f43

Let's honour this while creating ssh and keypair

commit_message:
Honour ssh_key_type config for keypair and ssh clients

With [1] Tempest added support for 'ecdsa' key types
using a new config option validation.ssh_key_type.

Let's honour this while creating ssh and keypair
clients. This is needed atleast for latest openssl
package in CentOS 9-stream where support for 'rsa'
key is dropped.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tempest/+/807465

Closes-Bug: #1963907
Change-Id: I1e4621ca9c02231d02df09fa758eae5c55eb0f93

commit_message:
Update master for stable/yoga

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/yoga.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/yoga.

Sem-Ver: feature
Change-Id: Ib1bfe9d5a77a947ef0d7920958cd5a2a301f9867

subject: Remove _standard_attr_segment_lib and use definition from neutron-lib
messages:
[{'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2021-06-05 10:34:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2021-06-05 12:01:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Neutron Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with run-Cloudbase Neutron Hyper-V CI

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/794957/1 : FAILURE in 1h 26m 14s'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2021-06-24 10:24:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

There is an error in the n-lib definition of 'standard-attr-segment' [1]. This extension requires "segment" and at the same time, "segment" extension requires "standard-attr-description" and "standard-attr-segment".

The n-lib definition differs from the extension definition removed in this patch. First you need to fix n-lib.

[1]https://github.com/openstack/neutron-lib/blob/c2879ec1739d1425bcc762d4b6584ee241f995ca/neutron_lib/api/definitions/standard_attr_segment.py#L25'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2021-08-15 08:29:40.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

This review is > 4 weeks without comment, and failed Zuul jobs the last time it was checked. We are abandoning this for now. Feel free to reactivate the review by pressing the restore button and leaving a 'recheck' comment to get fresh test results."}, {'account_id': 13861, 'date': '2022-02-21 06:49:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2022-02-22 08:07:31.000000000', 'content': 'Restored'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2022-02-22 08:22:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Neutron Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with run-Cloudbase Neutron Hyper-V CI

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/794957/1 : FAILURE in 13m 49s'}, {'account_id': 13861, 'date': '2022-02-22 08:32:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2022-02-22 08:47:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Neutron Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with run-Cloudbase Neutron Hyper-V CI

[{'created': '2021-06-05 10:34:18.000000000', 'message': 'Remove _standard_attr_segment_lib and use definition from neutron-lib

It is available in Neutron lib since version 1.16 so pretty long time
now.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I13699f8c494a15d8bb9e13f767f2725f7cab9f4f
Related-Bug: #1765008
'}, {'created': '2022-02-22 08:32:50.000000000', 'message': "Remove _standard_attr_segment_lib and use definition from neutron-lib

It is available in Neutron lib since version 1.16 so pretty long time
now.

Also move standard_attr_segment to optional extensions
for segment, as standard_attr_segment is startd-attr
extension for segment extension and requires segment
extension[1], keeping it in required_extensions of segment
creates a cyclic dependency.
It was originally added in required_extensions with [2] while
in n-lib port of api definition(unused currently) it's added as
optional[3] which makes sense and so same is done with this patch.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron-lib/+/562331
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/571292
[3] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron-lib/+/577866

Change-Id: I13699f8c494a15d8bb9e13f767f2725f7cab9f4f
Related-Bug: #1765008
"}, {'created': '2022-02-28 12:44:02.000000000', 'message': "Remove _standard_attr_segment_lib and use definition from neutron-lib

It is available in Neutron lib since version 1.16 so pretty long time
now.

Also use segment api definition from neutron-lib, it's available
since version 1.19.0. The api definition from neutron-lib also
avoids circulary dependency b/w standard-attr-segment and segment
extension[1].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron-lib/+/577866

Change-Id: I13699f8c494a15d8bb9e13f767f2725f7cab9f4f
Related-Bug: #1765008
"}]
commit_message:
Remove _standard_attr_segment_lib and use definition from neutron-lib

It is available in Neutron lib since version 1.16 so pretty long time
now.

Also use segment api definition from neutron-lib, it's available
since version 1.19.0. The api definition from neutron-lib also
avoids circulary dependency b/w standard-attr-segment and segment
extension[1].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron-lib/+/577866

Change-Id: I13699f8c494a15d8bb9e13f767f2725f7cab9f4f
Related-Bug: #1765008

commit_message:
Follow up for unified limits

This addresses remaining comments from the unified limits series to add
type hints to new code and add a docstring to the is_qfd_populated()
method in nova/quota.py.

Related to blueprint unified-limits-nova

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-03-04 17:17:06.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/yoga

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/yoga branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Id32e779db908d75aa0dd944578c5f3e2dad4155a
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/yoga

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/yoga branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Id32e779db908d75aa0dd944578c5f3e2dad4155a

commit_message:
Fix network-environment.yaml ipv6 {{network.name}}Routes

Right now {{network.name}}Routes is only rendered properly
for ipv4. This adds condition to check for ipv6 routes
and adds them if set.

Change-Id: If8f6c9eb46db96c087f19de028359246bb46cbc5

'}, {'created': '2022-03-09 02:40:24.000000000', 'message': 'Fix subprocess usage

capture_output parameter of subprocess was used but it is
supported in python 3.7 or later, not supported in python 3.6.
This patch changes it to equivalent.

This patch also fixes parameter type set to sol_detail to string
since sol_detail must be string. It was byte wrongly.

commit_message:
Fix subprocess usage

capture_output parameter of subprocess was used but it is
supported in python 3.7 or later, not supported in python 3.6.
This patch changes it to equivalent.

This patch also fixes parameter type set to sol_detail to string
since sol_detail must be string. It was byte wrongly.

Closes-bug: #1964071
Closes-bug: #1964280
Change-Id: I5c360d158372d9be93eb2222db15fd10e97462f6

commit_message:
DNM - Replace sha1 to sha3_512

sha1 is not recommended when using FIPS, leading some functions
to fail.

Change-Id: If8e75f580f9b20c3d71a7deadd7aa535e6481df5

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/yoga

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/yoga branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I78b12f832750c144752f8138e4283b1735367280

commit_message:
Do not set ineffective [alarm_auth] url

The [alarm_auth] url parameter has never been implemented. This change
removes the parameter from devstack installation because it's just
ineffective.

[{'created': '2022-03-04 14:50:12.000000000', 'message': 'Fix for verifying introspected data

This fixes verification of introspected data.

For physical baremetal introspection scenario, specification of the
physical server may differ with existing flavor data,whereas for
virtualised baremetal server, it can be matched.

the introspected data does not match with flavor data causing failure
in verification of introspected data. Hence, current fix is verifying
introspected data if greater than 0.

commit_message:
Fix for verifying introspected data

This fixes verification of introspected data.

For physical baremetal introspection scenario, specification of the
physical server may differ with existing flavor data, whereas for
virtualised baremetal server, it can be matched.

When the introspection is performed on physical baremetal server,
the introspected data does not match with flavor data causing failure
in verification of introspected data. Hence, current fix is verifying
introspected data if greater than 0.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/ironic/latest/install/configure-nova-flavors.html

Change-Id: I9ff1364e1baf99579a3d7b8cb5fc2ab012030173
